meta.title: From SOPHOMORE to SLUMP
meta.author: Sandy Weisz and Mao Reynolds
meta.message: It’s finally fall. The Raddles this week are all related to "fall". Sophomore slump refers to people in their second year of something, like high school and university, or in their second attempt at something, like an album, TV show or film, who are failing to live up to the accomplishments of their first try.

ladder.clue: One who is two years above a <>
Change the I in <> to an A, then anagram, to get an explanation
Change the /ē/ (long e) in <> to an /ā/ (long a) to get a fruit
Fruit that is also a shade of <>
If <> didn't do it, maybe it was this guy
Word you might use to describe a juicy, ripe <>
Change one letter in <> to get a way to sit
